description.p: Paladins of the Oath of the Raven dedicate their souls to the service of the Raven Queen. These knights honor the beauty of life and the sanctity of death, and swear to destroy anything that disrupts the natural cycle. Known as Knights of the Raven, they serve as the Raven Queen’s emissaries in the mortal realm.
The Oath of the Raven demands reverence for death as an impartial certainty, and for the passage beyond the veil as a necessity.
Let the End Come. All lives move toward their final moment. Do not hasten it, do not delay it.
Guard the Passage. The dead must pass beyond the veil. Suffer no force that binds a soul against its time.
Preserve the Cycle. Those who fracture the cycle of life and death must be stopped.
Stand Beyond Judgment. Do not weigh the soul or pass sentence. You are not the arbiter—only the still hand.
You gain the following Oath Spells at the paladin levels listed. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

td.em: protection from evil and good, bane

description.p: You gain the following two Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

Chains of Shadow. As an action, you invoke the still will of the Raven Queen. From the shadows beneath your foes, chains of living darkness rise in silence, binding them where they stand. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature’s speed becomes 0 for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus. If the affected creature is an undead or a fiend, it is also restrained by the chains and has disadvantage on attack rolls for the duration. A creature affected by this feature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The Final Judgement. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to invoke the Final Judgement of the Raven Queen. The creature is instead reduced to 1 hit point. If the creature is undead or a fiend, this feature has no effect.

sheet.description: As an action, chains of living darkness rise from the shadows beneath creatures of your choice within 30 feet. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, its speed becomes 0 for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus. If the target is an undead or a fiend, it is also restrained and has disadvantage on attack rolls. Affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
When a creature you can see within 30 feet would be reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to reduce it to 1 hit point instead. This has no effect on undead or fiends.

description.p: If you aren’t incapacitated, you and friendly creatures within {{aura:radius}} feet have resistance to necrotic damage and have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
At 18th level, the radius increases to 30 feet.

description.p: Beginning at 15th level, any creature that dares to strike you draws the quiet attention of the Raven Queen. Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it is marked until the end of your next turn. While marked, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against effects you create, and whenever you deal damage to it, the blow carries additional necrotic force equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). For undead and fiends, the additional necrotic damage is doubled, and the marked creature cannot regain hit points while the mark persists. This feature has no effect while you are incapacitated.

sheet.description: When a creature hits you with an attack, it is marked until the end of your next turn. While marked, it has disadvantage on saving throws against effects you create, and when you deal damage to it, it takes extra necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). Undead and fiends take double this extra damage and can’t regain hit points while marked. No effect while you are incapacitated.

description.p: As an action, you become the Avatar of the Raven Queen for 1 minute. Shadow gathers around you, and vast raven wings of living darkness unfurl from your form. While in this state, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet, can hover, and move without sound. Your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

In this form, fear and influence find no purchase in you. You are immune to the frightened and charmed conditions, and you automatically succeed on saving throws against effects that would forcibly move you or knock you prone.
More than this, death itself recognizes your presence. Whenever you deal damage directly to a creature, that damage accepts no denial: resistance is ignored, and immunity is treated as resistance.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Become the Avatar of the Raven Queen for 1 minute, gaining silent flight, immunity to fear and charm, stability against forced movement, and the ability to ignore resistance (treat immunity as resistance) whenever you deal damage directly to a creature.
